Key Arguments: The legislation is seen as an attack on freedom of speech, a fundamental right.
The government cannot objectively determine what is true or false.
The vast amount of information available makes it impossible for any group to discern truth from falsehood comprehensively.
The legislation could cause harm by censoring truths, as illustrated by the example of COVID-19's origin.
Censorship could lead to despotism and totalitarianism.
Notable Quotes: Freedom of speech is a fundamental right of every Australian.
